alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Douglas and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Devil`s Head, or 30 miles south of Denver, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roxborough Park, Sprucewood, South Platte, Perry Park, and Devil`s Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
